utterances.speaker: TARLOV

utterances.sentences: I think that, and I just want to say that I think that the Democrats will show up at the hearing, Jesse, because all of them are auditioning for the primary in 2020.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They are getting a lot of pressure not to show up. So, we'll see. And I can't believe you called her a reasonable Democrat. She's -- if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb16', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb16', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: PERINO

utterances.sentences: Coming up next, President Trump's latest attack on his opponent. We've been talking about him, Joe Biden.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: President Trump mocking Joe Biden's late campaign schedule ahead of the first big debate Tuesday. But Biden has kept a relatively a low profile this week and the president hit them last night. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb17', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb17', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.sentences: The bedwetters.

utterances.sentences: They've been talking -- right, Jessica, they call them the bedwetters. Right?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: I am not one and had not --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What is the obsession with bedwetting? You act like it's unnatural or a problem.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, after the age of two it usually is. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb19', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb19', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I beg to differ. Some people --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: And before the age of 80.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I got to say, it does seem like if this election is on outworking somebody, then President Trump is showing like he is in three states today. And one of them is like a 9 p.m. event. So, yes, he is out there, he is doing it. But there are the bedwetters and the Democratic Party are saying, gosh, this is what Hillary did. Hillary didn't work hard enough. She never went to Wisconsin. It's not going to work. But you talk with his campaign and they say, we are sticking with our strategy. We feel very confident. We are steady as she goes. Just one other thing I would say though, President Trump -- we talk about it here on cable news so you see all his activities and Biden too, but what you don't see is the local news coverage in the places where he's going. And local news coverage is often, just one, it's kind of tough, sometimes the interviews are tougher. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb20', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb20', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But the coverage is important and it's big and it's in the community and all people are talking about it. One of the things I've heard from reporters that local media is very frustrated at the Biden campaign because if they do go anywhere, they are not inviting local press, they are not doing a lot of interviews. They're like, so the local media is like, wait, you just like left to come and say that you are here but you are not participating in our process.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. One of the pieces they picked up here, Jessica, I think since August 11th when he picked Kamala Harris to be V.P., Biden has taken 22 days off. So, he's in 22 days, that's basically three weeks where Joe Biden didn't leave his house.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Americans are entitled to vacation time with paid leave. Joe Biden is not taking a day off where he is just sitting in bed, I don't know watching cable news all day and live tweeting it as the president of the United States of America does --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Maybe he's doing debate prep.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: -- and I appreciate his viewership. But Joe Biden has been getting the briefings. He has surrogates that are out everywhere. I would love to see Kamala Harris be taking more questions. She is super sharp, she's good. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb21', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb21', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); } She's very --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: What's going on with that?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So, she's taken no questions.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: She's not, as far as I understand she is not taken press gaggle questions and I think she should. But when I hear about the bedwetting Democrats, so a group that I am not a member of personally or politically, the media being upset about this, because obviously it's their job to want to ask questions and talk to the candidate. I will refer everyone to how the campaign is going which is what you would be hearing from Biden folks. So, he's maintained his lead nationally, he is still edging Trump in key swing states. And this is how we got through the primary and everyone said, Joe Biden is toast. Look what happened to Iowa, look at New Hampshire, and then he said wait, it could maybe African American person vote?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: yes.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: And then we could see where this primary actually is? And then he swept through. So, his strategy is working for him. It's just that we're all sitting around here and complaining about it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Katie, do you think it's working?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: I'm not sure yet if I think it's working. I think the polling that we are seeing which is a one snapshot of what's happening, it doesn't talk about the millions of doors and the RNC and the Trump campaign are knocking on, it doesn't talk about the people who maybe haven't made up their mind. And it doesn't take into account people who are now just starting to pay more attention to the fact that there is a possibly --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Our newly registered voters because there are a lot --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Right. Which Republicans are doing a really good job --

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: In Florida.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: -- in places like Florida, Pennsylvania in registering new voters. So, if they want to pay attention to the polling that we have, then maybe he is doing well. But in terms of the broader picture and the fact that they have not just surrogates out on television but surrogates in local markets like Arizona. Eric Trump is there this week. You had Ivanka Trump in North Carolina last week. Lara Trump has been all over Florida, Don Junior was in Pennsylvania. I mean, they are really working for it. And the big thing with Hillary Clinton wasn't just that she didn't show up, it's that she took voters for granted.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: They felt like she just didn't care. And so, Joe Biden can say well, I care about your health, but the interesting part of that too, is that this isn't March or April. A lot of these states that he is trying to win voters then are opening up not because the governor said that they can, but because the people want to move forward with their lives while taking social distancing and other measures into account.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: But they --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: So, it's the extreme version of moving forward in the name of protecting people's health.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: I mean, Trump is running super-spreader events, let's be honest about what's going on.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, that's not us. Greg, do you want to answer the question or call a lid?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Call a lid. I'd like to call a lid.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Call a lid?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know what the thing is, I think you are being unfair to Joe. Trump has been in three states but Biden has been in three states too, confusion, semi-conscious and unconscious today. So, I'm pretty -- he's got -- this guy he's got more lids than a Pandora factory. We'll be right back. But I have an idea for the Trump campaign. Come up with a new product. Biden lids.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And they're literally they're just -- an eye mask for taking a nap. Just Biden on this -- like it's called Biden's lids and everybody puts them, you can sleep anywhere with them. I think that would be fun.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's so cute.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, it is cute. That's all he got.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Very cute.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Are you selling those?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Calling the lid now?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'm calling the lid. Yes, I'm taking a break.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'm going to go work on my fund-raising, i.e., bottle of whiskey.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Coming up next, new bombshell revelations about the Russia investigation. Details ahead.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: New revelations in the Russia investigation. Document show that a member of special counsel Robert Mueller's team thought that the Russia collusion probe was a, quote, "dead end," and that the prosecution of Michael Flynn was part of an attitude to get Trump. And Attorney General Bill Barr revealing that a primary source with the Steele dossier was investigated for suspected ties to Russia. President Trump weighed in on this earlier.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Did you see the stuff that just came out on Russia? So, we caught them cold, Max. We caught them cold. It was a whole conspiracy. It was the worst thing anyone has ever seen and it was a takedown. They were the ones conspired.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: They got caught.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Let's see what happens. Let's see what happens. We went through three years of -- of crap.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Crap, indeed. Dana, do you think that there is room with less than 40 days out with the election to make the, quote, "Russia hoax" a plot line again for voters going to the polls on November 3rd and before, or is this just what Trump loves to talk about?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, I think that, one, I think you should talk about it because there is new information. I'm -- I sort -- I want to see the entire report.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Because I feel like when things are dripped out like this, that like next week, Jesse says there will be more documents on Monday. We'll have more maybe them by the time it comes out. There is another one that disavows that part. So, when it drips and drops, I don't love it. But I do think that, this is serious stuff and it needs to be -- I'm glad that they are investigating it. Will it affect the election? I feel like those decision -- those voters are already baked in, so I don't know how much of a difference it will make in actual vote.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Yes. Because we are seeing in this election versus 2016 that there are basically no undecideds left, right?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: It's about 90 to 92 percent of Americans know what they are doing. So, I want to turn to you, Jesse. We talked about Michael --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, I'm undecided. I'm waiting for the debates.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Yes?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, let's see how those show up.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: You want to see how Chris Wallace does?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, I want to see that.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: And see who impresses you?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Here's what I saw. This is what we found out.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Because what they did it was the unredacted the little footnote in the I.G. report. So, it turns out Hillary Clinton paid for foreign interference in an election from Russia.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: What?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Because the primary source for the Steele dossier was a suspected Russian spy. How do we know that? The FBI investigated the guy for three years for being a suspected Russian spy. So, then the FBI knows he's a suspected Russian spy. They hide it from the court. They hide it from the court that Hillary paid for the dossier and then they doctored evidence to get the warrant. That's kind of the big deal. Then all of those other interviews from the FBI agent who was on the Mueller team and some of the text messages show there is no evidence of collusion the entire time. And that the Mueller team was out to get Trump from the beginning and that General Flynn, they had nothing on Flynn. They even looked into his finances without a warrant using national security letters. They had nothing on Flynn. And some of the FBI agents were actually so nervous, they took out an insurance policy because they thought that things were going to get turned around and do a criminal investigation against them. Because they were breaking so many laws. And they were joking about destroying their iPhones. That's pretty funny. And all this time the media has been reporting the Russia disinformation. How stupid are they?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: So, my favorite thing about doing this show is that I don't even have to ask you a question. And you're just going to tell everybody what you think about it. Greg, I see you nodding. And you did hear Hillary Clinton, your favorite names you mentioned. So, part of in these new documents, it's revealed that Durham is going to be looking at the Clinton Foundation again, an entity that has been investigated more than anything else that I can think of. Where do you think something like that goes? And do you think that voters have moved on from talking about the Clintons? I understand she's on T.V., and I know that that annoys you? But people are lucky --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: How do you know what I know?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Because you told me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, I said, I love it.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Well, because you --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: OK. What I like is that now you, a Democrat, are concerned that viewers are getting tired of this story. For years, you're pushing it down our throats and now it's like, Jesse, this Russian business, isn't it time to move on? Dana, do we really need to talk about this? You guys have been making this talk about it every day. So sorry, now you're going to eat the breakfast that we've been eating. By the way, Jessica, just for today, can I call you Juan? So, Juan, how does it feel to be pushing this obstruction and collusion accusation only to find out that it's your side that had been doing it all along? You -- it was your group behind the Russian collusion, not the Republicans and not Trump. That's got it eats you up inside, Juan. I know Juan can't hear me, so I'm going to go even further. We now have concrete evidence of a coup attempt, right? This is a coup attempt. And we were all supposed to say don't say, coup, don't say coup. That's crossing the line. Well, now we can say coup. Coup, Marilyn McCoo and Billy Davis Jr. All right, the big question is, Juan, will the media do two things, take a moment of self-reflection? No. How about backing up the car in reversing direction and paying amends by investigating this new story which is what a fair and balanced journalist would do? No.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They aren't even covering it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: OK, so one would go --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You're now Jessica.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You're now -- OK, go.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: But I did the thing. And like, what a load of crap. I mean, of you want to talk --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, you have to say -- you have to say, I can't believe this table.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: I wish there was a table. But I actually really can't believe this table. And if you want to talk about new evidence coming out, let's talk about Andrew Weissmann's book where he says actually --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Oh, yes, the trustworthy Andrew Weissmann who is one of the worst most corrupt prosecutors in the entire country.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Excuse me.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Look, can we get the $32 million that was spent on the special counsel investigation back to the taxpayers? I mean, the fact that this happened, even though they knew there was nothing there and the trust that was broken between the American people and things like I don't know, the Federal Bureau of Investigation, which is supposed to protect people and not be used as a political weapon against political opponents that you don't like. And people are wondering, well, you ask the question, does this affect voters? Well, if Joe Biden is going to try and portray himself as someone who has a deep 40-year Washington record. He was part of the Obama administration which carried this out. There was a meeting in the Oval Office on January 5th about these things. So, yes, it has to do with government corruption. And President Trump still portraying himself as an outsider who isn't involved in all of the corruption of D.C. which is turned into government being weaponized against conservatives and political opponents under the Obama ministration which happened multiple times in a number of ways.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: We're out of time, so I can't go point by point. But if you're concerned about taxpayer dollars, President Trump can take the weekend off golfing. That'll save you millions, and then you have your Mueller money back.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: -- destroying the country and --

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: It's not about -- he didn't destroy the country.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I thought we're out of time.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Well, I'm in-charge, actually.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, but I want to do "FASTEST SEVEN."

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: The "FASTEST SEVEN" is up next.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Welcome back. It's time for the "FASTEST SEVEN." First up, is the Coronavirus pandemic changing the landscape of the restaurant business? Social distancing is not a concern at an English cafe staffed by robot waiters. More eateries may be following suit. A recent study found that restaurant tears are increasingly interested in using robot technology. So, Dana, do I have to tip a robot 20 percent?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No. I also think that this doesn't really have anything to do with Coronavirus. This has to do with the increases in minimum wage.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Yes, I think true.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So, I think that restaurants are looking to this. I don't love the option. I love my waiters and waitresses. I love the interaction. I'm not a fan of the robot, but I do think that this is a direct result of innovation and also just the cost of doing business.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: You know, Greg, at the airport, you have to tip the iPad 20 percent. It starts at 20 percent.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You do tip it in Bitcoin. That's all robots take. Look, I think it's bad that we're placing waiters and waitresses. Who do you flirt with? But here's the upside. Robots don't write screenplays. Therefore, they're not going to tell you about their screenplay while you're sitting there instead of taking your order. And they're also not distracted by celebrities or good-looking people like me, which slows your order up. So, robots are just completely objective. But it is sad because you lose another job to the evil overlords.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: But, Jesse, if you complain about your food, aren't the chances of less -- that it'll get spit in and send it back?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, is the chef a robot too?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Soon to be.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Good question.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Don't the -- don't the chefs do the spitting stuff at the waiter?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Hey, stop it. Stop it, Jesse. Stop it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh, they're cooking.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Go out eating.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK. Wait, are they waitress or are they chefs?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Robot chefs. Chefs, they're cooks.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh, they're chefs? Why did you bring up waitresses?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: That's robot cooks, right?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, because we changed the story.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Because I thought they were taking the food to the table.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Anyway, Jessica --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: We changed the story.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: -- as a restaurant-goer, do you like this idea or not, the cook being a robot?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: I think innovating is always exciting to see how it works out, and it's a gimmicky thing. But I'm like everybody who likes to have interactions with people. And at a time right now, when we are losing so many restaurants and so many restaurant workers, we lost 80,000 in New York City alone, I don't -- I'm not dying to see a robot chef. I would like to see a human chef.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: We all know how I feel about robots so, we will move on. Next up, it turns out animals really are great. A new study finds watching cute animal videos can significantly reduce feelings of stress and anxiety. So, if you're feeling worked up right now, take a deep breath and wait for "ONE MORE THING" because Dr. Greg will be ready to see you shortly. So, Greg, you've been giving therapies of THE FIVE.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Shortly, shortly? What's that supposed to mean?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Oh, I know exactly what it means.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know? OK, so I would like to take --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Are you insulted and offended?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, I would like to take -- yes, my contribution to the healing arts is quite obvious. An interesting side note, animals feel less anxiety watching videos of humans.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Really?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They're watching THE FIVE right now.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Do you watch animal videos to feel better?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I watch animal attack videos to feel better. So, some people like the key ones. I'll dial up, you know, like some predator on the African plane when they kind of like weed a little Gazelle out of the pack and then attack it and feast on it. That really relaxes me.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: OK, that's very weird. Jessica?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Animals are great. And I was recently -- I had not actually seen in-person the dogs that work at hospitals and was in -- one were the dogs are going from room to room. And you think of it more as a kid thing, but the adults love it too and you just --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't want a dog as a doctor. What hospital do you go to?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: With the robot cooks.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Dana, we both love dogs both in person and on T.V.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I love to watch the videos. Jasper likes to watch fish aquarium videos. But one thing I did -- when I was reading this, the first thing I thought of was if watching animal videos all day makes you happier, why isn't Greg happier?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That was so uncalled for, Dana, uncalled for.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Finally, have we gone too far with the flavors of fall? Kraft is rolling out a pumpkin spice macaroni and cheese in the U.S. after the product was so popular in Canada. Jesse, don't ruin the good box Kraft mac and cheese with pumpkin spice, only for lattes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I've never had anything that's been a pumpkin spice flavor.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Not even on drinks?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I'm tempted to say something sexist. And you know what? I'm just - - I'm calling the lid.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Go for it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I'm calling a lid.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Calling a lid.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I was going to say, I'll meet you across.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I can't. I'm calling a lid instead.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Greg, why ruining things like guacamole and macaroni and cheese with like peas and pumpkin spice flavor?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Which one was pumpkin spice in the band?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: The Spice Girls.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: OK, so, I don't mind them destroying stuff that I don't eat. But don't come for my steak. There better be no pumpkin spice steak, no pumpkin spice bacon, no pumpkin spice vitamin zero. Could you imagine how disgusting that is? The only foods that you can do pumpkin spice with is stuff that already has no flavor, correct?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Well, the latte --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Well, coffee has flavor.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, I mean, it's black. It's black. I mean, it's strong black, but you can -- you can tweak it. That's why you have the other -- what am I talking about?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right, call a lid.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Calling you a lid. Jessica?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: I also don't know what Greg was talking about. I'm not a pumpkin spice fan lattes or otherwise. And it does feel like a lack of innovation, right? You can come up with something new. There are tons of flavors you can throw together. This seems like a destruction of Kraft.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Maybe the pumpkin spice should be left to pumpkin pie, right? Can we all agree on that that we all like pumpkin pie?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Only from the can, though.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Not a real pumpkin.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Right, no. I want the cheap stuff.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Not all natural. You want the bad stuff. OK. All right, Dana, do you have a comment on pumpkin spice?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I'll stick with the lid. I'll be under the lid.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: OK. "FAN MAIL FRIDAY" is up next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: We should have done the other --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's "FAN MAIL FRIDAY." We're answering your question. First one from Cara B. What movie scared you as a kid, Jessica?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: A lot of movies. Dumbo was the scariest --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Very scary.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Very scary.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: And I want early for that. It's my dad's favorite, so he wanted me to see it. And --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It made me nauseous. That and Fantasia made me nauseous.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Fantasia is dizzying.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, very dizzying. I never liked that. Katie?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: I hated The Ring and The Exorcist.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But that's -- you saw that as a kid?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: I think I saw a part of the exercise as a kid at (INAUDIBLE) house and it was like, no, no, no, leaving the room. I was too scared.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I love that film. Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I cried at the end of the Return of the Jedi.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's not scary.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We were -- when the mask comes off, the face --

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Oh, you cried from fear?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I had to leave -- yes, I had to leave. Yes, I was scared. I was little. I had to leave the theater. And my dad's friend who had taken a bunch of us young kids there -- and then since I had to leave since I was crying so hard, dad had to take all the other kids and everyone was mad at me because I made everybody leave and miss the ending.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: They're probably still mad at you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, well, get over it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Danna?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Wizard of Oz, the flying monkeys.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They flying monkeys. I had to say, I had the same feeling with March of the Wooden Soldiers. Do you remember that?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Laurel and Hardy movie with Santa Claus?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Laurel and Hardy? How old are you?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I was going to say Deep Throat, but I figured that joke was too much. All right --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yet, you made it anyway.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, but I cushioned it by saying, I didn't make the joke about --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Stroke the cat, Gutfeld.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right. That's some kind of euphemism. All right, Stacy asks, "Name something a friend of yours had growing up that you wished belonged to you?" All right, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: There is a story really rich kid growing up, and I used to go to his house. We used to play with all his toys. And then he came over to my house and I didn't have any toys. And he goes, your house is boring. You don't have any toys. And then my mom said, use your imagination. It's all coming back to me now.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, my God. You're having a mental breakdown. Dana, was there something --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, I often had to do with my parents did not really care about the fashion of the day.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right? And so, I remember I wanted -- when I was a kid, jeans, if you had a design on the pocket, those were really popular.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So, my mom -- and I've told this story before, but my mom came up with an idea for design on the pocket and she went to the sewing store and got one of those iron-on patches.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And she put a big D on my pocket. And all my friends had jordache jeans.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, I bet that affected you for --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes. I mean, I still have -- I'm feeling fashion un-forward.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I can tell. I can tell.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: You're beautiful, though.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Nice try, Jessica. All right, what was the -- what did a friend have that you wished?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: I ended up getting it because I have the best mom ever. But when Tamagotchis came out, everyone in my class had one and all day, they were like, hold on, I have to feed my baby, and like I have to give it medicine. And then, I wanted one, and I wanted one, and I got it, and then school banned them. So, my mom had mine and my sister's Tamagotchis to take care of all day. But it was a Tamagotchi.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes. I think I was a little bit jealous of those little -- those Barbie jeeps that you drive. I don't think I ever asked my parents one.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Dana still drives one.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes. But then, when I got into high school, my parents let me dive a real Jeep, so it worked out just fine.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Excellent. Yes, I'm always jealous my neighbor had a little brother.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Really?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. And I took it. All right, time to go. I was going to say a tape of Deep Throat, but I thought maybe I'd built that joke. "ONE MORE THING" is up next.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: A major programming note. Joining us here on THE FIVE on Sunday, we'll have special coverage ahead of the first debate. And then catch the presidential debate on Tuesday night moderated by our own Chris Wallace. That begins at 9:00 p.m. Eastern on the Fox News Channel. Okay, it's time now for "ONE MORE THING." Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We'd like to send our warm wishes to Dr. Ron Paul who suffered a little medical episode today during a live stream. But he did tweet this nice note out and says he's doing well and thank you for your concern. So, pray for Ron Paul. Also, pray for me because I'm live Saturday night 8:00. Anything could happen. We have the Trump rally and who will he nominate? We're hearing it to either between Amy Coney Barrett and doctor -- Judge Jeanine, right?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Or Dr. Siegel. I mean, that would be amazing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Siegel is in the mix. He's the dark horse.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right, Saturday night 10:00 p.m., we are live, psychologically anyway. We got Walter Kirn, Joe Concha, Kat Timpf, Tyrus. It starts at 10:00 p.m. tomorrow night. Now, let's do this quickly, shall we? Greg's Illusion of Accuracy. Take a look at this incredible video this Corgi just sinking these baskets from all different angles. So how is he so talented? Well, it's because they're not showing you all the other takes that spanned over months and months when they forced this poor dog to do this over and over again until they got three or four in a row.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's why you tape your show.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, exactly. Never -- good point. Never accept information until you see what's been left out. Let this be a lesson to all of you. My work is done here. I'm leaving.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right, that's a good little Corgi. So, I want to talk about echo. Did you hear that, echo, echo, echo? This is actually a dog. So, for the last five months Echo is that -- who was a therapy dog, has been helping L.A. County firefighters and paramedics just with morale and mental health, keeping everybody happy. Echo is donated to the station from the Patriotic Service Dog Foundation after a firefighter and paramedic Jack Windale spent four years trying to get the program off the ground. So, since joining the Echo team, he's -- Echo has basically been all over battling -- helping -- well, he hasn't been battling the fires. He's helping the firefighters who are battling the wildfires. The 3-year-old Labrador was the runt of the litter, OK, but has gone to make a huge impact. So, Greg, I mean, you know what I mean about that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, I don't.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right, Katie?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Thank you, Echo. All right, there's no better time to get out in your national parks. It's great outdoors. And the National Park Service is helping you do this tomorrow for free for National Public Lands Day. The annual event was established to connect people with the green space in their community and encourages the use of space for education, recreation, and health benefits. Here are some of the parks that are free admission tomorrow, Grand Canyon, Yellowstone, Yosemite, Joshua Tree, Rocky Mountain Park, and the Everglades. So, we've been wanting to go.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's awesome. I love the national parks. Jessica?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: It makes me want to be an outdoorsy person.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: You can come with me. I will go.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: I'll hold you back for sure. So, the big news of the week was obviously the passing of Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg. There have been countless tributes honoring her but one of my absolute favorites was her trainer Brian Johnson dropping to the ground for a few shops in Notorious RBG's honor this morning as she lay in state. Ginsburg's workout routine became an integral part of her pop culture appeal, famously pumping iron in her diva sweatshirt for a documentary about her life. Johnson -- I know. Amazing. Johnson's gesture highlighted their connection, her age-defying behavior, and served as a good reminder that even in our 80s, we should be working out. Rest in peace, Justice Ginsburg.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Indeed. I hadn't seen those pushups. I love it.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Amazing, right?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Jessica, great to have you. That's it for us. Tune in Sunday for our special pre-debate coverage here on THE FIVE. Content and Programming Copyright 2020 Fox News Network, LLC.
